uno.uno_game
Class Game_Engine

java.lang.Object
  uno.uno_game.Game_Engine

public class Game_Engine
extends Object

The Game_Engine class conducte a simulation of the card game UNO using the official rules that ship with an UNO deck. Each game is played as a number of rounds. A round lasts until one player reports zero cards in their hand. A game ends when one player's score reaches 500.

Version:
v 1.0 April 20, 2015
Author:
S. Sigman

Constructor Detail

Game_Engine

public Game_Engine(int numGames)

The Constructor for Game_Engine sets up the UNO simulation to play the indicated number of games.

Parameters:
numGames - The number of games to play in the simulation.
Method Detail

deal

public Hand[] deal()
The deal method performs a deal for a game. One hand for each of the current players is returned. Hands are not associated with individual players in this method.

Returns:
An array containing one hand for each player.

discardCard

public void discardCard(UNO_Card card)
The method discardCard should be called by the player in order to play a card by placing it on the discard pile.

Parameters:
card - The card to place on the discard pile.

doIDraw

public boolean doIDraw()
The doIDraw method should be called by a player when they see a DRAW_2 card or a WILD_DRAW_4 card in order to determine if they need to draw cards.

Returns:
If the player needs to draw cards, true is returned. If the player needs to play against the card, false is returned.

drawCard

public UNO_Card drawCard()
The drawCard method should be called by the player when they need to draw a card from the deck. In the case that a player is passed a DRAW_2 card or a WILD_DRAW_4 card the player should check the drawCards flag by calling the doIDraw method.

Returns:
The top card from the deck.

getCurrent_Color

public int getCurrent_Color()
The getCurrent_Color method may be called by the player in order to check the current color of play. The current color should be queried whenever the player is passed a WILD card or a WILD_DRAW_4 card with the drawCards flag set to false.

Returns:
The current color to play aginst.

logGames

public void logGames(boolean show)
The method logGames toggles the display of individual game stats in the log file.

Parameters:
show - If show is true, individual games are logged. Otherwise they are not.

notifyPass

public void notifyPass(Player player)
The notifyPass method should be called by the player when they do not discard a card.

Parameters:
player - A reference to the player who is passing on a turn.

notifyUNO

public void notifyUNO(Player player)
The notifyUNO method must be called when a player has only one card remaining in their hand after discarding a card.

Parameters:
player - A reference to the player who is declaring they have one card remaining in their hand.

notifyWon

public void notifyWon(Player player)
The notifyWon method should be called by a player when the last card in the player's hand is discarded.

Parameters:
player - A reference to the player who is declaring they have won the current round.

numCards4EachPlayer

public int[] numCards4EachPlayer()
The method numCards4EachPlayer returns an array containing the number of cards in each player's hand with the exception of the player making the call. Hence, the size of the array will be one less than the number of players in the game. The card count at position 0 corresponds to the number of cards in the hand of the next player to play and represents the counts for players in order of play at the time the call is made.

Returns:
An array contining the number of cards currently in each player's hand.

setPlayColor

public void setPlayColor(int clr)
The setPlayColor method should be called after a player plays a WILD card or a WILD_DRAW_4 card.

Parameters:
clr - The color the player wishes to become the current play color.

setUpFirstTurn

void setUpFirstTurn()
This method adds the intitial card to the discard pile and sets the correct round parameters.

start

public void start()
The start method should be called to start an UNO simulation. The method will play the specified number of games and log games statistics to the the log file, UNO_Simulation.log.
